title: Mechanical energy of a block-string system

content.question: A block is set on a rough horizontal table where frictional forces are not negligible. The block is pushed against a horizontal spring, and it is released at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. The spring pushes the block across the table. At time <math alttext="t equals t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, the block leaves the table. The block strikes the ground at time <math alttext="t equals t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following describes the change in mechanical energy of the block-spring system for times <math alttext="0 less than t, less than t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="t sub 1, less than t, less than t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="0 less than t, less than t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math><math alttext="t sub 1, less than t, less than t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>Stays the sameStays the same

<math alttext="0 less than t, less than t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math><math alttext="t sub 1, less than t, less than t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>IncreasesDecreases

<math alttext="0 less than t, less than t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math><math alttext="t sub 1, less than t, less than t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>Stays the sameIncreases

<math alttext="0 less than t, less than t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math><math alttext="t sub 1, less than t, less than t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>DecreasesIncreases

content.answer: <math alttext="0 less than t, less than t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math><math alttext="t sub 1, less than t, less than t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>DecreasesIncreases

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
